Subtest instructions:
Show the child the sheet of invented words in the student stimuli booklet. Say:
Here are some made-up words. I would like you to read as many as you can. Do not spell the words, but read them. For example, this made-up word is: “ut”.
Let’s practise: please read this word [point to the word “dif”]:
  • If the child says "dif", say: Very good, “dif.”
  • If the child does say "dif" correctly, say: This made-up word is “dif.”

    • Now try another one. Please read this word     [point to the word “mab”]:
  • If the child says "mab", say: Good, this word is “mab.”
  • If the child does not say "mab" correctly, say: This word is “mab.”

    • When I say “begin,” read the words as quickly and carefully as you can. Read the words across the page, starting at the first row below the line. I will keep quiet and listen to you, unless you need help. Do you understand what you are to do? Ready? Begin.

    Reminders:
  • Start the timer when the child reads the first word.
  • Follow along and touch any words read INCORRECTLY (they will turn blue). Touch the word again to count self-corrections as correct (it will no longer be blue).
  • Stay quiet, except when providing answers as follows: if the child hesitates for 3 seconds, provide the word, point to the next word and say “Please go on.” Mark the word you provide to the child as incorrect.
    AFTER 60 SECONDS, SAY “STOP.” Touch the [Stop] button, then touch the last word attempted so that a yellow box appears on that word. (Be sure it is still appropriately marked either correct or incorrect).
    Early stop rule: If you have marked as incorrect all of the words on the first line, say “Thank you!”, touch the [Stop] button, mark the last letter attempted ensuring that it is still marked incorrect, and go on to the next exercise.
